title: Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve: Places
body: Places      Â      Taken in about 1900, this photo shows a path leading from the Mississippi River levee to Chalmette Monument. Library of Congress  Places are not just sites where we can see a view, go to a museum, talk to a ranger, or enjoy a program. They're also memories, history, and sometimes a glimpse of the future. To find out about the six sites of Jean Lafitte and what they offer today, click here. To find out about the history of places in or related to the park and to find links to research about park sites, follow the links below:  Chalmette Battlefield and the Battle of New Orleans Fazendeville, a community founded in 1867 on land that is now part of Chalmette Battlefield
